title: Remote keyless system
extract: A keyless entry system is an electronic lock that controls access to a building or vehicle without using a traditional mechanical key. The term keyless entry system originally meant a lock controlled by a keypad located at or near the driver's door, which required entering a predetermined numeric code. Such systems now have a hidden touch-activated keypad and are still available on certain Ford and Lincoln models.
extract_html: A keyless entry system is an electronic lock that controls access to a building or vehicle without using a traditional mechanical key. Such systems now have a hidden touch-activated keypad and are still available on certain Ford and Lincoln models.
